words.example: Being tall is an advantage to a basketball player.
The cold weather caused her to get sick.
I had my choice of five doors to open.

words.definition: a group of people who live together
words.example: The kids from my community usually play together.
A dead person is usually buried in the ground.

words.definition: how far it is between two things
words.example: The distance between the Earth and the Moon is 384,400 kilometers.

words.definition: to run away from something bad
words.example: The butterfly could not escape from the cage.
My sister and I have to find a better way to face our differences.
The little boy followed his mother home.
She was filled with fright.

words.definition: the spirit of a dead person
words.example: Many people are afraid of ghosts.
Only one individual could win the bicycle race.

words.definition: an animal that lives with people
words.example: Out of all my pets, the dog is my favorite.
I was happy to finally reach my destination.

words.definition: to go back to a place
words.example: I was happy to return home to my mom after school.
My dog survived her fall into the water.
She was upset because she broke her toy.

words.definition: the sound a person makes when they talk
words.example: He used a microphone, so everyone could hear his voice.

words.definition: the condition of the air (hot, rainy, windy, etc.)
words.example: The weather can be sunny, rainy, or cold.
Many people believe that owls are very wise animals.
